newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Controversial Brazil tax bills set for Wed vote.
newsitem.headline: Controversial Brazil tax bills set for Wed vote.

text.p: Brazil's Chamber of Deputies voted to give priority status to two bills that would free small companies from paying tax, paving the way for a vote on Wednesday on the legislation itself, an official said.

If approved, the legislation -- which the government says will cost $4.0 billion in lost tax revenues -- would exempt small companies with turnover of up to 204,000 reais a year from tax and employer contributions.
The legislation is the brainchild of Sen. Jose Sarney, who claims it will create five million new jobs. The bills have already been approved in the Senate.
